Documentation.DeveloperDocu: Complete list of parameters describing a solver problem
Documentation.UserDocu: Complete list of parameters describing a solver problem
Scales of values of parameters. Scale sets the order-of-magnitude of the parameter, and affects solver's tendency to change it, and the resulting precision.
How many degrees of freedom there is in this ParameterStore.
addOne(label = '', value = 0.0, scale = 1.0, fixed = False, tag = 0): creates a new parameter and returns a reference to it.
addN(n): creates n parameters, and returns list of references to created parameters. n can also be a list of tuples (label, value, scale, fixed, tag), to initialize the parameters.

constrainEqual(param1, param2, mean_out = True): makes the parameters equal by creating a redirection. The constraining is done by changing MasterIndex of parameters. Existing equality groups and fixedness of parameters are taken into account.
mean_out: a boolean parameter. If False, the resulting value is copied from one of the parameters. If True, and both parameters aren't fixed, the values are averaged.
Returns a string indicating the result: either 'Constrained' (if successful), 'Redundant' (if nothing to do). If the request is conflicting (i.e., constraining two fixed unequal parameters), an exception is raised.
deconstrain(parameter = None): resets MasterIndex of specified parameter. If None, all redirections are cleared, i.e. all constraints added via constrainEqual are removed.
sync(parameter = None): updates ownValue of parameter to match the value of equality group. If None, it's done to all parameters.
allFree(): returns list of uniquely variable parameters, the degrees of freedom.
allFixed(): returns all fixed parameters (both directly fixed, and locked down by constrainEqual)
allDriven(): returns all parameters that are redirected (their OwnValue's may be not up to date).
